Patent Information.Patent Title: Antimicrobial Peptides And Methods Of Making And Using Same
Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention provides a new methodology combining MD simulations and database-guided high-throughput screening to rationally design pore forming membrane-active peptides. The present inventive methodology is able to allow tuning of a range of structural and functional properties such as pore size and selectively targeting membranes with specific lipid compositions. The present inventive methods will ultimately allow de novo design of membrane-active peptides for a wide range of biomedical applications, including for example, antimicrobial agents.

Sequence Information.Source: Hyla punctata (Polka-dot tree frog) (Spotted tree frog)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.14715660]Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC=6.1-8.0 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC=48.8-64.0 µg/ml), Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC=24.4-32.0 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.14715660] HSP1 MIC concentration (256 μg/mL = 195.2 μM) produced 4.7% hemolysis against human erythrocytes.
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Has antibacterial and antifungal activity. A weak hemolytic activity has been detected.
